alert.note: Alert for Canon City Vicinity, Eastern Fremont County; Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Northern El Paso County, Monument Ridge, Rampart Range Below 7500 Ft; Pikes Peak above 11000 Ft; Pueblo Vicinity, Pueblo County Below 6300 Feet; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Above 11000 Ft; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft; Trinidad Vicinity, Western Las Animas County Below 7500 Ft; Walsenburg Vicinity, Upper Huerfano River Basin Below 7500 Ft; Wet Mountains above 10000 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 11:47PM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN PUEBLO HAS ISSUED A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT FOR... The entire I-25 corridor in southern Colorado from the New Mexico border to the top of Monument Hill... A band of moderate to heavy snow was pushing east out of the southern mountains at 11:45 PM. This band of heavy snow will move east across the I-25 corridor between midnight and 2:00 AM. This band of heavy snow will reduce visibility to 1/4 of a mile in places, and a quick inch or two of snow will be possible, Temperatures were relatively warm, but due to the heavy nature of the snow, slushy accumulations will be possible over the interstate.
